newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Telecom Eireann buys Motorola Eirpage stake.
newsitem.headline: Telecom Eireann buys Motorola Eirpage stake.

text.p: Ireland's state telecommunications body Telecom Eireann said on Friday it had signed an agreement to buy Motorola's 49 percent share in Eirpage Ltd.
This makes Telecom Eireann the sole owner, increasing its stake from 41 to 100 per cent.
Eirpage Ltd provides a paging service to about 40,000 customers, employs 59 people and has annual revenues of 3.5 million Irish pounds.
Telecom Eireann's Deputy Chief Executive Alan Corbett said: "Both ourselves and Motorola are very pleased with the outcome of the negotiations."
"As sole owner of Eirpage Ltd we plan to aggressively market the new messaging services as part of our overall total solutions approach to the marketplace," he said.
U.S.-based Motorola manufactures mobile communications equipment and designs GSM software employing more than 2,000 people in Dublin and Cork.
